philipm.cs5.software.development.user.system

Class ChessGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • philipm.cs5.software.development.user.system.ChessGame

  • public class ChessGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores the chess game (i.e. all board states). It also handles getting any potential computer moves.
    Author:
    mortimer

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChessGame

        public ChessGame(ChessBoardState[] statesSoFar,
                 boolean loadNeuralNet)
        Creates a chess game object storing all the states played so far
        Parameters:
        statesSoFar - All chess board states that have already occurred
        loadNeuralNet - Whether a neural network should be loaded when initialising the chess game

        Reads and loads opening book
        Returns:
        The opening book

      • getComputerMove

        public ChessBoardState getComputerMove(int computerLevel)
        Gets the computer move given the computer level as input.
        Parameters:
        computerLevel - An integer between 1 and 5 (both inclusive).
        Returns:
        The board state representing the move that has been executed

      • getComputerMoveMinimax

        private ChessBoardState getComputerMoveMinimax(ChessBoardState currentState,
                                               int computerLevel,
                                               int searchDepth)
        Implements the minimax algorithm and returns the board state that is to be played.
        Parameters:
        currentState - The starting board state
        computerLevel - The computer level. Levels from 2-5 are valid.
        searchDepth - The search depth for the minimax algorithm.
        Returns:
        The chess board

      • maxTurnMinimax

        private int maxTurnMinimax(ChessBoardState state,
                           int depth,
                           int alpha,
                           int beta,
                           int maxSearchDepth,
                           int computerLevel)
        Implements a recursive depth limited alpha-beta pruned minimax algorithm to evaluate which move the computer must make next. This is called by the maximising player
        Parameters:
        state - The board state to evaluate
        depth - The current search depth
        alpha - The value of alpha
        beta - The value of beta
        maxSearchDepth - The maximum search depth
        computerLevel - The computer level
        Returns:
        The board value

      • minTurnMinimax

        private int minTurnMinimax(ChessBoardState state,
                           int depth,
                           int alpha,
                           int beta,
                           int maxSearchDepth,
                           int computerLevel)
        Implements a recursive depth limited alpha-beta pruned minimax algorithm to evaluate which move the computer must make next. This is called by the minimising player
        Parameters:
        state - The board state to evaluate
        depth - The current search depth
        alpha - The value of alpha
        beta - The value of beta
        maxSearchDepth - The maximum search depth
        computerLevel - The computer level
        Returns:
        The board value

                          int computerLevel)
        Gets the value of a non terminal board state using an appropriate heuristic
        Parameters:
        state - The board state
        computerLevel - The computer level
        Returns:
        The value of the board

        public void addState(ChessBoardState state)

        Parameters:

      • getAllStates

        public ChessBoardState[] getAllStates()
        Returns all boards that have been played so far
        Returns:
        All chess board states as an array. Note this array is not a copy, so states should not be written to unless appropriate.

      • getCastlingRightsAfterCapture

        private static void getCastlingRightsAfterCapture(int yCoord,
                                                  int xCoord,
                                                  boolean[] copyOfCastlingRights)
        Updates copy of castling rights if move is made for that square. This is used to ensure that castle rights reflect a potential rook capture. If the y and x coordinate match the starting position of any rook, the castling option for that rook is set to false.
        Parameters:
        yCoord - The y coordinate of the move
        xCoord - The x coordinate of the move
        copyOfCastlingRights - A copy of the castling rights. This array will be manipulated.

      • getAllLegalBoardsFromMove

        public static java.util.ArrayList<ChessBoardState> getAllLegalBoardsFromMove(int yStart,
                                                                             int xStart,
                                                                             int yFinal,
                                                                             int xFinal,
                                                                             ChessBoardState state)
        Gets all legal board states from the chosen position. Note: normally only one legal board state will be returned but pawn promotion will return four states (one for each possible choice of piece). DOES NOT handle 50 move rule or other draw / win /loss conditions for current board, these must be handled elsewhere where appropriate.Note moves input must be legal
        Parameters:
        yStart - The y coordinate of the piece
        xStart - The x coordinate of the piece
        yFinal - The y coordinate of the move
        xFinal - The x coordinate of the move
        state - The board state to analyse
        Returns:
        All possible states. If no states exist, an array of length 0 is returned

      • getAllLegalBoardsFromState

        public java.util.ArrayList<ChessBoardState> getAllLegalBoardsFromState(ChessBoardState currentBoard)
        Gets all legal board states from the input current board state. DOES handle 50 move rule
        Parameters:
        currentBoard - The board state
        Returns:
        An array of all legal board states. If this array is of length 0, there are no legal board states from this board state

      • addChessBoardStateToArray

        private static ChessBoardState[] addChessBoardStateToArray(ChessBoardState[] array,
                                                           ChessBoardState stateToAdd)
        Creates new array of chessboards. Note this should only be called in the getAllLegalBoardsFromState method.
        Parameters:
        array - The array
        stateToAdd - The new state
        Returns:
        the new array

      • addChessBoardStateToArray

        private static ChessBoardState[] addChessBoardStateToArray(ChessBoardState[] array,
                                                           ChessBoardState[] statesToAdd)
        Creates new array of chessboards. Note this should only be called in the getAllLegalBoardsFromState method.
        Parameters:
        array - The array
        statesToAdd - The new states
        Returns:
        the new array

      • getAllLegalMoves

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAllLegalMoves(ChessBoardState board)
        Calls getAllLegalMovesFromSquare method on every square of the chess board and returns all moves. Read documentation of that method for details on moves
        Parameters:
        board - The board to analyse
        Returns:
        An ArrayList with all legal moves from the current board.

      • getValueOfMove

        private int getValueOfMove(ChessBoardState state,
                           int yStart,
                           int xStart,
                           int yEnd,
                           int xEnd)
        Estimates the value of a move, in order to rank the move values
        Parameters:
        state - The board state
        yStart - The starting y coordinate
        xStart - The starting x coordinate
        yEnd - The final y coordinate
        xEnd - The final x coordinate
        Returns:
        The value of the move

      • getPieceValue

        private static int getPieceValue(int PIECE)
        gets the value of a piece and returns it
        Parameters:
        PIECE - The piece
        Returns:
        The relative value of the piece

      • getAllLegalMovesFromSquare

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAllLegalMovesFromSquare(int yStartingSquare,
                                                                                int xStartingSquare,
                                                                                ChessBoardState board)
        Gets all legal moves that can be made from the square Notes: pawn promotion is treated as moving a pawn to the final rank. However, the actual piece chosen needs to be handled. Notes: half move clock is NOT handled by this method Notes: castling is treated as king moving two spaces to the left or right
        Parameters:
        yStartingSquare - The y index of the starting square
        xStartingSquare - The x index of the starting square
        board - The board state to be analysed
        Returns:
        An array list returning all legal moves from a square

      • isInCheck

        public static boolean isInCheck(boolean isKingWhite,
                                ChessBoardState state)
        Checks to see if king of input colour is in check in the current state. This method is used as part of the process to obtain all legal moves. Must be called on the correct king given who is about to move.
        Parameters:
        isKingWhite - The colour of the king to check
        state - The board state to check
        Returns:
        True is returned if the king chosen is in check and false is returned otherwise

      • getAllLegalMovesForKingIgnoringCheck

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAllLegalMovesForKingIgnoringCheck(int ySquare,
                                                                                           int xSquare,
                                                                                           ChessBoardState state)
        Gets all legal moves for king in square. Note king must be of correct colour. Castling is represented as the king moving two squares to the left or right. NOTE: You can't castle out of check but as this method ignores check, this will need to be handled.
        Parameters:
        ySquare - The y index of the king
        xSquare - The x index of the king
        state - The board state
        Returns:
        The moves

      • getAllLegalMovesForPawnIgnoringCheck

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAllLegalMovesForPawnIgnoringCheck(int ySquare,
                                                                                           int xSquare,
                                                                                           ChessBoardState state)
        Gets all legal moves for pawn at the square input. Note check is ignored and pawn promotion is treated as the pawn sitting on the final rank. En passant is supported but must be checked carefully. Note: must be called on pawn of the right colour given the board state
        Parameters:
        ySquare - The y index of the pawn
        xSquare - The x index of the pawn
        state - The board state
        Returns:
        All moves

      • addToEndOfArray

        private static int[][] addToEndOfArray(int[][] currentArray,
                                       int[][] newRecords,
                                       int arrayWidth)
        Adds new records to the end of an array
        Parameters:
        currentArray - The current array
        newRecords - The new records
        arrayWidth - The array width
        Returns:
        The new array

      • addToEndOfArray

        private static int[][] addToEndOfArray(int[][] currentArray,
                                       int[] newRecord)
        Adds new record to two 2d array. This record is appended to the bottom of the new array. Note newRecord must be of the same width as the current array
        Parameters:
        currentArray - the array
        newRecord - the record to add
        Returns:
        the new array

      • getAllLegalMovesForKnightIgnoringCheck

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAllLegalMovesForKnightIgnoringCheck(int ySquare,
                                                                                             int xSquare,
                                                                                             ChessBoardState state)
        Gets all legal moves for a knight ignoring check. Note knight in square MUST be of the same colour as the colour that moves next
        Parameters:
        ySquare - The y coordinate of the knight
        xSquare - The x coordinate of the knight
        state - The board state
        Returns:
        All moves

      • getLegalMovesForRookIgnoringCheck

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getLegalMovesForRookIgnoringCheck(int ySquare,
                                                                                        int xSquare,
                                                                                        ChessBoardState state)
        Gets all legal moves for rook (or queen) in position, ignoring check. This method must be called in a piece of the right colour
        Parameters:
        ySquare - The y coordinate of the rook (or queen).
        xSquare - The x coordinate of the rook (or queen).
        state - The board state
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all legal moves of width 2. If no moves are found, the ArrayList is of length 0.

      • getLegalMovesForBishopIgnoringCheck

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getLegalMovesForBishopIgnoringCheck(int ySquare,
                                                                                          int xSquare,
                                                                                          ChessBoardState state)
        Gets all legal moves for the bishop from the current state, ignoring whether the king is in check. This method must be called on a bishop (or queen) of the correct colour.
        Parameters:
        ySquare - The y index of the bishop (or queen)
        xSquare - The x index of the bishop (or queen)
        state - The chess board state to get the legal moves from
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all legal moves of width 2. If no moves are found, the ArrayList is of length 0.

      • getCurrentState

        public ChessBoardState getCurrentState()
        Returns the current board state.
        Returns:
        The current board state
